perturbation.original_text: From the first unit sold, Fox shall earn a royalty at the rate of ***** percent (*****%) of Licensee's Gross Receipts (as defined in the Agreement) from Licensee's sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products. ("IA2 Audio and Video Royalty"). For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.changed_text: From the first unit sold, Fox shall earn a royalty from Licensee's sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products. For the avoidance of doubt, Licensee may not recoup any portion of the Ice Age 2 Guarantee (as defined in Amendment 1) through its sale and distribution of the IA2 Audio and Video Wireless Products.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specific royalty rate (*****%), the modified text creates ambiguity regarding the actual royalty amount. While the text still refers to a royalty, the absence of a defined percentage makes the clause unenforceable and contradicts the initial intention of specifying payment terms. Other parts of the agreement references the "IA2 Audio and Video Royalty" which is no longer specifically defined.
perturbation.location: B. IA 2 AUDIO AND VIDEO WIRELESS PRODUCTS ROYALTY: 1. Royalty: (a)

perturbation.original_text: All VGSL and other CSP payments remitted directly to Fox pursuant to the VGSL Agreement and other CSP agreements with respect to the IA Audio and Video Wireless Products shall be treated in the same manner as set forth in Paragraphs 7(b)(ii) and 7(b)(iii) of the Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: All VGSL and other CSP payments remitted directly to Fox with respect to the IA Audio and Video Wireless Products shall be treated in a fair manner.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to 'Paragraphs 7(b)(ii) and 7(b)(iii) of the Agreement', the modification creates a contradiction. The original text explicitly directs how VGSL and CSP payments should be handled according to specific paragraphs in the Agreement. Now, it says that these shall be treated in a fair manner, which opens to an interpretation and creates uncertainty in enforcement as the method of dealing with those payments is no longer clearly defined.
perturbation.location: B. IA 2 AUDIO AND VIDEO WIRELESS PRODUCTS ROYALTY: 2. VGSL and other CSP Accounting:
